            INVESTMENT AND POLICY REVIEW UPDATE,TF033827-VIETNAM - POWER,TF033826-VIETNAM - POWER,TF033465-VIETNAM - POWER, GAS,TF033688-VIETNAM - POWER DEVELOPMENT,TF034042-VIETNAM - POWER

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated satisfactory, and
            sustainability is highly likely. The performance of the Bank
            was highly satisfactory, stemming from a project design that
            fitted with the prevailing sectoral objectives,
            straightforward procurement arrangements, and project
            supervision that worked closely with the borrower, namely
            the presence of an energy team in the field office. The
            performance of the Borrower was satisfactory, with
            appropriate entities involved in assisting the Bank in the
            overall design, and providing relevant technical, and
            financial inputs. Regardless of success, some key lessons
            may be drawn from the project, mainly that the need for
            coordination with the International Finance Corporation
            (IFC), in the preparation of a fast track project, involving
            the private sector within time, and budget constraints,
            would ensure smooth project preparation. For although the
            Government decided that it was not prepared to risk delays
            with the IFC's proposal, nor was it ready to establish
            a separate entity with majority private ownership, the issue
            was resolved by agreeing to the Bank's condition
            (build, operate, transfer approach), which ensured private
            sector participation. The protracted process of government
            approvals, such as long-term gas contract, and tariff
            adjustment, were risks much higher than envisioned, but
            flexibility, and the above-average staff skills demonstrated
            through all project stages, proved successful.
